meanings.definition: The shattering effect of a high explosive.
meanings.sent1: The brisance of the bomb shattered the windows in the building.
meanings.sent2: The military experts studied the brisance of different explosives.
meanings.sent3: The comical movie exaggerated the brisance of a tiny firecracker.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter had a brisance that lit up the room.
meanings.sent5: The brisance of the thunder made the ground tremble.

meanings.definition: The ability of an explosive to shatter or fragment materials.
meanings.sent1: The brisance of the explosive was crucial in demolishing the old bridge.
meanings.sent2: Engineers tested the brisance of the new explosive compound.
meanings.sent3: The children were amazed by the brisance of the popping balloons.
meanings.sent4: His words had a brisance that broke through her defenses.
meanings.sent5: The brisance of the fireworks painted the night sky with light.
